intro: Lepanthes guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan urn orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central America. It is characterized by its compact, pseudobulbous structure and produces showy, urn-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within the understory of tropical forests. Its leaves are usually dark green and fleshy, adapted to store water in its native habitat. Lepanthes guatemalensis is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its striking floral display and relatively easy care requirements.
